p: With regards to the young stems, already present in the sampling of 2017, the essential oil composition showed a qualitative overlapping with the FL-EO profile, with the dominance of 1,8-cineole ( 13) (53.7%), followed by terpinen-4-ol ( 21) (7.1%), sabinene (4) (6.7%) and α-terpineol ( 22) (5.7%). As for DL-EO, the high concentration of 1,8-cineole in the young stems was accompanied by a limited concentration of α-terpineol; the relative percentages of terpinen-4-ol ( 21), γ-terpinene ( 16) (4.0%), α-terpinene ( 8) (2.8%), α-phellandrene ( 7) (2.1%), terpinolene ( 18) (0.8%) and p-cymene ( 9) (1.5%) were instead higher than those in FL-80.
